evidence.pdf_reference: and g-C 3 N 4 components, with outstanding transportation of the photo-induced electrons and a longer charge carrier lifetime than the g-C 3 N 4 . We explored the as-prepared catalysts in terms of photocatalytic CO reduction (specifically, their photoreaction activity under UV-Vis irradiation).H 2 , CO, and CH 4 were the main products of TiO 2 NFs, TiO 2 MoS 2 , TiO 2 MoS 2 g-C 3 N 4 , and g-C 3 N 4 , as shown in Fig. S5.To ensure reliability, Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction was tested three times under the

are denoted as TiO 2 MoS 2 g-C 3 N 4 -1, TiO 2 MoS 2 g-C 3 N 4 -2, and TiO 2 MoS 2 g-C 3 N 4 -3 depending on whether the amount of g-C 3 N 4 (50, 75, or 100 mg, respectively); each was produced with the same mass (100 mg) of TiO 2 MoS 2 .Furthermore, photoresponsive films were fabricated by spin-coating.First, 200 mg of the fabricated catalysts were prepared separately in 1.5 mL of ethanol.After dissolving completely, the solution was spin-coated on FTO (11 cm 2 ) at 2500 rpm for 60 s and then dried in the

Activated CO 2 adsorption sites are crucial for improving selectivity in photocatalytic CO 2 reduction.Co-catalysts incorporating rare or noble metals have previously been required to achieve high CO 2 selectivity (S CO2 ); thus, noble-metal-free catalysts with high S CO2 are desirable but challenging to realize.We introduced S-scheme heterojunction using noble-metal-free TiO 2 MoS 2 graphitic carbon nitride (g-C 3 N 4 ) with a strong redox ability showing S CO2 90.This heterostructure improved CO 2

for photoinduced electron and hole pairs.However, after the flower-like MoS 2 grown on the TiO 2 NFs, the CO and CH 4 yields were 1.7 and 1.6 times higher, respectively, than those of the TiO 2 NFs alone.Furthermore, after the g-C 3 N 4 has been uniformly coated on the TiO 2 MoS 2 , the CO and CH 4 yields dramatically increased to 3.3 and 3.6 times those of g-C 3 N 4 alone, respectively.These high yields confirmed that the interconnected interfaces in these materials enhance the electron transport and

(Fig. 5(b)).When the light was irradiated into the catalysts, electron and hole pairs were photogenerated at TiO 2 , MoS 2 , and g-C 3 N 4 separately.The excited electrons from the CB of TiO 2 are transferred to VB of g-C 3 N 4 and these photogenerated electrons and hole pairs will recombine easily due to its Coulombic attraction at the interface between TiO 2 and g-C 3 N 4 .Afterwards, the powerful electrons from the CB of g-C 3 N 4 will move into the CB of MoS 2 , reacting with absorbed CO 2 molecules

Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

evidence.pdf_reference: were measured under UV-visible (UV-Vis) irradiation (12 mWcm 2 ) using a 300-W Xe-arc lamp (66,984; Newport, USA). To study the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction of the as-prepared samples, we used a homemade stainless steel reactor with a volume of 260 mL.First, 22 vol of triethanolamine in 125 mL of the aqueous solution was added as a hole scavenger.Approximately 20 mg of the catalyst was coated on the FTO.Prior to reaction, the reactor was tightly sealed with a connector and CO 2 gas was then added up to

for 60 s and then dried in the oven for 2 h.The dried films were sintered at 150 C for 1 h to remove the remaining ethanol solution; in this way, the photoresponsive films were fabricated so that their photoelectrochemical properties and capacity for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction could be evaluated. The transient photocurrent density and electrochemical impedance spectra (EIS) were measured using a three-electrode quartz cell in 0.5 M Na 2 SO 4 and a potentiostat (VersaSTAT 4; Princeton Applied Research,

horn for 10 min.After that, 0.1 g of Na 2 MoO 4 and 0.2 g of thiourea were added and stirred until completely dissolved.The solution was transferred to a Teflon mold at 200 C for 24 h to grow the flower-like MoS 2 nanosheets by the hydrothermal method.After cooling, the TiO 2 NFs with MoS 2 were centrifuged several times with distilled water and ethanol to remove any salt and residue, until a pH of 7 was reached.Finally, the obtained catalyst, which has a dark grey color, was dried in an oven.We denote
